alert.note: Alert for Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 6:46PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Marion County through 715 PM EDT... At 646 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 9 miles southeast of Williston, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Marion County. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
